result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A Kautz

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 10:32am.
Defendant John A Kautz in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court informs the parties of the scheduled judicial rotation, directing Attorney Fischer to counsel Mr. Kautz on this. 
recess 10:36am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on November 2nd at 10:40am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Status Conference on January 5th at 3:30pm--JA note in comments that case is at prelim stage
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order for Cont - adj IA time change only

ec: DA and Atty Fischer (10/13/22--ma)
Stip for Cont - Adj IA 10/21/22 time change only

Adjustment Number: 22A 231230,
Payable Number: 195973,
Receipt Number: 22R 018438,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

[ae] case called 1:57 PM Defendant John A Kautz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (PD appears for bond-purposes only). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

Right to Counsel given; The Court will address bond only today


The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to possess or ingest any alcohol
--maintain absolute sobriety 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 

The Court preserves all rights and tolls preliminary hearing time limits 

recess 2:05 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/21/22 at 1:15 pm [PFAC is to be sent to jail with bond]
